question: What condition does the dotted line in the following growth cha represent?
exp: Constitutional delay in growth & pubey: The given curve shows that the child's height remains below and parallel to the 3rd percentile line during childhood. Pubey is delayed. An acceleration of growth is seen during mid & late adolescence, with the final adult height attained being normal.

question: Which of the following is not a feature of constitutional growth delay?
exp: Distinction between constitutional delay in growth and familial sho stature Feature Constitutional growth delay Familial sho stature Height Sho Sho Height velocity Normal Normal Family history Delayed pubey Sho stature Bone age Less than chronological age Equal to the chronological age Pubey Delayed Normal Final height Normal Low but normal for target height

question: A child presented with sho stature and some abnormalities of the hand and pelvis. What is your diagnosis.
exp: Image A: Sho limb Image B: Trident hand Image C: Champagne glass pelvis All these features seen in ACHONDROPLASIA Other features include: A - Autosomal dominant inheritance C - Champagne glass pelvis H - Hand abnormality O - Obesity N - Neurological problems D - Delayed motor milestones R - Recognized at bih O - Bowing of legs P - Proximal limb shoening L - Large head S - Sho stature I - Interpedicular distance between veebrae is decreased
